index.name: php
index.subtitle: PHP
index.about: PHP is a popular general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited to web development. Fast, flexible and pragmatic, PHP powers everything from your blog to the most popular websites in the world.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about PHP language.

videos.title: PHP CodeIgniter Tutorial 1 - Basics/Download
videos.description: This screencast explains an introduction about CodeIgniter framework.

videos.title: PHP CodeIgniter Tutorial 2 - Models/Database
videos.description: This screencast explains how to create models and integrate a databases in CodeIgniter.

videos.title: PHP CodeIgniter Project 1 - Creating website from Scratch
videos.description: This screencast will teach you how to create a project using CodeIgniter.

videos.title: PHP CodeIgniter Project 2 - Header, Footer and Navigation bar
videos.description: This screencast will teach you how to build header, footer and navigation bars.

videos.title: PHP CodeIgniter Project 3 - Login System
videos.description: This screencast will teach you how to build a simple login system for your application.

videos.title: PHP, Request and Servers
videos.description: A quick and good video explaining how a PHP server works when a client do some requests there.

videos.title: Should I or not use PHP framework?
videos.description: In this videos, let's learn the benefits of a PHP framework and when it'll be a good idea to use one.

videos.title: Introduction OOP Design in PHP
videos.description: In this lesson we’ll review the course outline, describe the environment being used for the screencasts, and discuss some additional resources.

videos.title: Isolating Global State
videos.description: Now that we’re bootstrapped and ready to go, we’re going to take first step to becoming object-oriented, by isolating global scope.

videos.title: Introduction to PHP Testing
videos.description: Welcome to the PHP Testing Basics course, I'm Andrew Perkins and throughout this course I'll teach you the very basics of testing PHP web applications.

videos.title: PHP Regular Testing
videos.description: Here we will examine the process of how someone may go about testing a PHP application by writing manual tests, after writing application-specific code. This is a good learning exercise because you get to start with something very easy, and it is still better than writing no tests at all.

videos.title: PHPUnit
videos.description: In this lesson we’ll take a look at the PHPUnit testing framework. We’ll explore its features and basic installation instructions so that we can work with it in the next section.

videos.title: PHP Codeception
videos.description: In this lesson we’ll take a look at the Codeception testing framework. We’ll explore its features and basic installation instructions so that we can work with it in the next section.

videos.title: PHP Behat
videos.description: In this lesson we’ll take a look at the Behat testing framework. The Behat testing framework uses stories to describe how your application should behave. We’ll explore its features and basic installation instructions so that we can work with it in the next section.

videos.title: PHP Namespaces in 120 seconds
videos.description: Still not quite comfortable with PHP 5.3 namespaces? No problem! Give us 120 seconds and we'll introduce you to all the crazy characters ('namespace', 'use' and '\') and show you how they work.

videos.title: Dependency Injection Introduction
videos.description: In this tutorial, we'll see dependency injection in action, why it's important, and how it relates to services and service-oriented architecture. We'll also refactor our application to use a dependency injection container, using a fantastic.

videos.title: The Worlderful World of Composer
videos.description: In this Screencast, you'll learn how to install and configure Composer and use it to integrate third-party libraries into any PHP project (even something like Wordpress!).
